results.title: The Story of fashion. Vol 02: the art and sport of fashion
results.creator_credit: Eila Hershon, Roberta Guerra and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
In the second episode of this three part series presented by Karl Lagerfeld, the influence of film and television stars within fashion is discussed. From the designers who outfitted Claudette Colbert, Joan Crawford and Josephine Baker to Nolan Miller, head costume designer for “Dynasty”. The rise of the celebrity role model and the creation of a certain style is also explored. It highlights the influence of individual designers such as Jean Patou and Coco Chanel and also examines the relationship between fashion style and history, art and photography. Includes interviews with Pierre Cardin and other leading industry players.
results.title_for_label: The Story of fashion. Vol 02: the art and sport of fashion

results.title: Miro: theatre of dreams
results.creator_credit: Robin Lough, Christopher Martin, BBC-TV, Poorhouse Productions and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
A biographical documentary on Spanish painter and sculptor Joan Miro (1893-1983), renowned for his part in the 1920s surrealist movement in Paris in his exploration of the inner world of dreams and the unconscious in a range of works. The documentary traces his involvement at the age of 85 in putting together a strongly political theatrical piece with young actors under the banner of Claca theatre, a theatre ideally aimed to translate to performance anywhere and as a surreal vision of traditional Catalonian folk culture. The program discusses his fascination with this historical theatrical form from childhood and the seriousness behind the concept of monsters in the Claca production which underlines his opposition to tyrants in Spanish history, a reference to the fascist invasion of Spain in 1936 and Franco’s subsequent leadership. Interwoven with the coverage of the progress of Claca’s production is a very personal study of Miro’s life and work through interviews with Miro himself on the inspirations for his work from childhood to recent history and the underlying philosophy in his work of not distorting life but seeing it with the third eye, that is seeing it as a veil in the world of dreams. The program also explores the contents of his studio in Majorca, his working materials and the items he collected from travel abroad. A meditation on their reference points in his work and artistic process is presented through stills of his work and visuals of him working in his studio and discussing his instinctive style of painting which draws from ordinary life to create a surrealist poetic. Footage of the premiere of Claca Theatre when Catalonia returned to an independent state and a presentation of Miro’s thoughts at the time closes the program and underlines the continued significance and intensity of Miro’s artistic vision of history interwoven with the immediacy of everyday life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin Lough, Christopher Martin, BBC-TV, Poorhouse Productions and RM Arts

results.title: The Unquiet spirit: the life and art of Edgar Degas (1834-1917)
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, BBC and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Edgar Degas (1834-1917) was one the great French artists of the 19th Century. Often associated with the French impressionists, Degas set himself apart, preferring a studio practice studying human nature as opposed to ‘plain air’ paintings of landscape done by other impressionists of the time. This documentary examines the reputation and paradoxical personality of Degas in relation to society, his art career and life’s work and seeks to readdress this complex personality that too often was misrepresented during his lifetime. The sheer versatility and scope as an artist was not fully known until close to his death when a life’s worth of sculptures were revealed. Included throughout are examples of his drawings, paintings, prints and sculptures and picturesque views of France that serve to inform the atmosphere of Degas’s cultural environment. Obsessed with the great classical tradition it was Degas who took the study of the human figure towards modernism, able to articulate an intimacy of life that was both penetrating and shrewd. Written and narrated by David Thompson

results.title: The Quiet family
results.creator_credit: Mari Kim and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: This 2D tale of horror has an unexpected twist to it - all is not what it seems! An Addams type of family deals with the consequences of having their little darling make friends with the rest of the world. Mainly b&w with splashes of colour. Hand-drawn animation.

results.title: Lucio Fontana: reaching out into space
results.creator_credit: Pierre Neel, Poorhouse Productions and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
The founder and major practitioner of the spatialist movement in art in the 1940s, Lucio Fontana, is the feature of this thorough and personal documentary which covers the expanse of his working career and his ongoing fascination with the concept and evolution of space in artistic practice. Through discussion of his major manifesto’s on the theory of spatialism and the range of work in multiple media through which he expressed his ideas and preoccupations, the program explores the notion of bringing real as opposed to illusory space into art and assesses Fontana’s achievement in the expression of this in the experimentation that marks his celebrated career. The program also traces his derivation of inspiration in creating art forms which are said to break out into space in the traditions of Baroque art and architecture as well as his influence on other artists of the same and subsequent periods. Through interviews with colleagues, friends, family and art critics, a profile of the artist emerges in both personal and artistic terms, with a celebration of the progression of his work and the importance of his impact on artistic expression for his multimedia experimentation, theoretical sophistication and professed feeling for humanity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierre Neel, Poorhouse Productions and RM Arts
